title: 11 – THE FANTASTIC BEER FACTORY
body: Beer is more than a recreational drink. One might think it’s just an excuse to justify alcoholism, but the truth is this beverage is the main food source for the general population. The difference lies in how people here relate to magic. Hurry or laziness makes even a natural task, like fermentation, empowered by arcane forces. Their addiction is of a different kind, surely…

If this is the first time a Hero interacts with this scene, write down the Boil Fast and Ferment Fast Statuses in the Party’s Campaign Log and place the Callix Malt, Zullan Malt, and Aral Malt Adventure Item cards with the Grain side face up near the play area.

RULE – MECHANISM INTERACTION
This Interaction does not use charges. Instead, unless a resolution specifies that the token is removed, it remains on the board. In addition, the options for this Interaction are not exclusive—They can be repeated, and sometimes the game state will lead to different outcomes.

RULE – CONTINUOUS INTERACTION
The same Hero may interact with this scene more than once per turn if desired. As a Cube Action, a Hero may EXPEND 1 AC to interact with this scene again. They may also choose to interact with it by simply using their Minor Action as normal.

title: 1.1 – INSPECT THE ARCANE INSCRIPTIONS
body: Ancient Elvish inscriptions lie carved in the kitchen like a recipe book. Many words are easy to recognize, as the common language of the Drunagorians descends from it for reasons that, although still intriguing, don’t matter now. Piecing the words together, you decipher the message…

Make a Wisdom (blue) Attribute Test with Difficulty 15. Each Wisdom cube you have gives you a +2 bonus to your roll. If you succeed, proceed to resolution 1.7. Otherwise, continue reading below. If you follow the Path of Mystics, you succeed without needing to roll.

...the milled grains are mixed with water in the basin to form the mash, which is then filtered and boiled. Finally, the product of this cooking is left to rest and ferment in the large barrel, resulting in the desired drink. Each grain requires its own treatment: Zullan must be boiled slowly and fermented for a long time, Callix, on the contrary, is best enjoyed when boiled quickly and fermented for long. Aral is not the best, but is served anyway, being a fail-proof blend.
Proceed with the Adventure.

actions.text: Succeed in Wisdom Test (or follow Path of Mystics) - (interaction 1.7)

title: 1.2 – CHOOSE A GRAIN STRAIN
body: If there are no Adventure Item cards of the Grain type near the play area, the Heroes have already used up all remaining stock and there are no more grains to take. Proceed with the Adventure. Otherwise, continue reading below.

Though it is a drink, like almost everything brought to the table, perfection begins in the soil, with the right choice of grains. Almost the entire crop is lost, but fortunately, a few brews were saved from the relentless passage of time, stored in magical saddlebags. Can you cook something with them?

Take one of the separated Grain cards. You should not flip it until instructed to do so.
Proceed with the Adventure.

actions.text: If no Grain cards are available

title: 1.3 – MIX WITH WATER, FILTER, AND BOIL A GRAIN
body: A spring, natural or magical—you cannot tell—pours water into a suspended basin where the mashed grains are mixed with water to form the mash. The mixture is soon filtered into a closed pot where arcane inscriptions indicate the temperature at which the substance will be magically boiled.
If you have any Adventure Item cards of the Grain type, proceed to resolution 1.8. Otherwise, continue reading below.
Your fingers itch and a mischievous smile crosses your face, but one ingredient is missing: how could you cook mash without having the mix of malt grains, hops, and crushed herbs?
Proceed with the Adventure.

actions.text: If you have a Grain card - (interaction 1.8)
If you don't have a Grain card

title: 1.4 – FERMENT A MASH MIXTURE
body: The hair on your arms stands on end as you feel the mystical energy reverberating from the barrels, such is the strength of the enchantment blessing them. Miraculous yeasts, conjured from who knows where, await the arrival of the mash to begin its magical fermentation.
If you have any Adventure Item cards of the Mash type, proceed to resolution 1.11. Otherwise, continue reading below.
Your fingers itch and a mischievous smile crosses your face, but one ingredient is missing: how could you ferment a mixture that doesn’t yet exist?
Proceed with the Adventure.

actions.text: If you have a Mash card - (interaction 1.11)
If you don't have a Mash card

title: 1.5 – ADJUST THE BOILING POT TEMPERATURE
body: Ancient Elvish inscriptions adorn the base of the pot and two enchantments are easy to recognize: one of fire and one of time, intertwined to subject the mixture inside the pot to temperature, pressure, and hours of cooking in the blink of an eye. The right words determine the duration and intensity of the boil...
Erase the Boil Slow or Boil Fast Statuses noted in the Party’s Campaign Log.
Write down, at your choice, the Boil Slow or Boil Fast Status in the Party’s Campaign Log.
Proceed with the Adventure.

title: 1.6 – ADJUST THE AGE FERMENTER
body: This curious barrel is surrounded by Ancient Elvish inscriptions that quickly reveal its utility: like a time chamber, it can perform days’ worth of fermentation in a blink. By uttering the command, you determine how long the mixture will rest and ferment inside.
Erase the Ferment Fast or Ferment Slow Statuses noted in the Party’s Campaign Log.
Write down, at your choice, the Ferment Fast or Ferment Slow Status in the Party’s Campaign Log.
Proceed with the Adventure.

title: 1.7 – YOU DECODE THE INSTRUCTIONS
body: ...the milled grains are mixed with water in the basin to form the mash, which is then filtered and boiled. Finally, the product of this cooking is left to rest and ferment in the large barrel, resulting in the desired beverage. Each grain requires its own treatment: Callix must be boiled quickly and fermented slowly, Zullan, on the other hand, is best enjoyed when boiled for a long time and fermented briefly. Aral is not the best, but it’s served anyway, being a fail-proof blend.
Proceed with the Adventure.

title: 1.8 – YOU HAVE SOMETHING TO COOK
body: The grace of the process elicits a sigh of admiration from all of you. The work of several hours of attention and focus is completed in mere moments, and the sound of cooling echoes through the chamber, suggesting the mixture is ready. What kind of beverage will it become?

Choose one Adventure Item card of the Grain type you have. If the Boil Slow Status is written in the Party’s Campaign Log, proceed to resolution 1.9. Otherwise, if Boil Fast is there, proceed to resolution 1.10.

actions.text: If Boil Slow Status is active - (interaction 1.9)
If Boil Fast Status is active - (interaction 1.10)

title: 1.9 – YOU COOK THE MASH
body: Just like the seasons, grains are not all the same. Some, when boiled longer than they should be, leave bitter notes of failure in the taste of the drinks. Others, however, come to life with a myriad of hypnotizing aromas, justifying the title of master that experienced brewers carry and the recognition of their craft as an art. Are you a good apprentice?

If the chosen card is Zullan Malt or Aral Malt, flip it to its Mash side. Otherwise, the Grain is ruined—but all is not lost. Return that card to the box and take the Breath of Summer Adventure Item card. Grains stored this way can no longer be used in this Adventure.
Proceed with the Adventure.

title: 1.10 – YOU COOK THE MASH
body: Just like the seasons, grains are not all the same. Some, when boiled longer than they should be, leave bitter notes of failure in the taste of the drinks. Others, however, come to life with a myriad of hypnotizing aromas, justifying the title of master that experienced brewers carry and the recognition of their craft as an art. Are you a good apprentice?

If the chosen card is Callix Malt or Aral Malt, flip it to its Mash side. Otherwise, the Grain is ruined—but all is not lost. Return that card to the box and take the Breath of Winter Adventure Item card. Grains stored this way can no longer be used in this Adventure.
Proceed with the Adventure.

title: 1.11 – YOU HAVE THE MASH FOR FERMENTATION
body: The ancient barrel thirsts, and you are the only one who can satisfy it. Opening the metallic hatch that doesn’t even creak—as if centuries couldn’t rust it—you pour in the mash. The magical words uttered in sequence make the runes engraved in copper shimmer with a blue glow captivating to the eye...

Choose one Adventure Item card of the Mash type you have. If the Ferment Slow Status is written in the Party’s Campaign Log, proceed to resolution 1.12. Otherwise, if Ferment Fast is there, proceed to resolution 1.13.

actions.text: If Ferment Slow Status is active - (interaction 1.12)
If Ferment Fast Status is active - (interaction 1.13)

title: 1.12 – THE FERMENTATION IS SLOW
body: The subtle hissing reverberates within the piece, more felt than heard. The sound resembles a whistling kettle and lingers while the runes fade one after another—but there are many, and the whole process takes a bit longer than a horse's neigh. The question remains: is the time enough to ferment your mixture the right way?

If the chosen card is Refreshing Wort, it is destroyed: store the card. Grains stored this way can no longer be used in this Adventure. Otherwise, if the card is Searing Wort or Strong Wort, return it to the box and take the appropriate Adventure Item Beer card (Callix Red or Aral Stout, respectively).
Proceed with the Adventure.

title: 1.13 – THE FERMENTATION IS FAST
body: The subtle hissing reverberates within the piece, more felt than heard. The sound resembles a whistling kettle and lingers while the runes fade one after another—but there are few, and the whole process takes no longer than a quick yawn. The question remains: is the time enough to ferment your mixture the right way?

If the chosen card is Searing Wort, it is destroyed: store the card. Grains stored this way can no longer be used in this Adventure. Otherwise, if the card is Refreshing Wort or Strong Wort, return it to the box and take the appropriate Adventure Item Beer card (Zullan Weiss or Aral Stout, respectively).
Proceed with the Adventure.
